questions.question: Why is PWM required for DC motor speed control?

answers.b: It controls average power delivered to the motor.

explanations.a: Incorrect: PWM does not increase voltage.
explanations.b: Correct: PWM adjusts the average voltage and power, controlling speed.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Direction control needs an H-bridge.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Overheating is not PWM's main purpose.

questions.question: What is the working principle of a servo motor?

answers.a: It rotates continuously at constant speed.
answers.b: It moves to a specific angle based on pulse width.
answers.c: It vibrates using high frequency signals.
answers.d: It uses analog voltage for angle control.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Continuous rotation occurs only in modified servos.
explanations.b: Correct: Servos use PWM pulse width to set position.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Servos use PWM signals, not analog voltage.

questions.question: How does a stepper motor maintain precise control?

answers.c: By moving in fixed incremental steps.
answers.d: By adjusting pulses based on sound waves.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Free rotation is for DC motors.
explanations.c: Correct: Stepper motors move in controlled steps for precision.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Sound is unrelated to motor control.

questions.question: Which example correctly matches a motor with a real-life IoT application?

explanations.a: Correct: DC motors are commonly used for smart curtain automation.
explanations.b: Incorrect: Servos are for angle control, not vibration.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Fans use DC/AC motors, not steppers.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Robotic joints require stepper/servo motors.

questions.question: What happens if a wrong pulse sequence is given to a stepper motor?

answers.b: It may skip steps or rotate incorrectly.
answers.d: It behaves like a DC motor.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Wrong sequences cause irregular motion.
explanations.b: Correct: It may lose position accuracy or move in the wrong direction.
explanations.c: Incorrect: It doesn't get permanently damaged normally.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Stepper motors never behave like DC motors.

questions.question: How do DC motor and servo motor differ in control?

answers.b: DC motor uses PWM for speed, servo uses PWM for position.
answers.c: Both use serial data for control.

explanations.a: Incorrect: DC motors do not use angle control.
explanations.b: Correct: DC = speed control, Servo = precise angle control.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Serial is not used for basic motor driving.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Servo motors depend entirely on PWM pulses.

questions.question: Why can’t a typical servo motor rotate full 360°?

answers.a: Because its body is too small.
answers.b: Because an internal stop limits rotation.
answers.c: Because it has only two wires.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Size has no influence on rotation limit.
explanations.b: Correct: Internal gears and stops restrict movement to 0–180°.

questions.question: How can the direction of a DC motor be reversed in simulation?

answers.a: By changing PWM duty cycle only.
answers.b: By reversing power supply polarity via H-bridge.
answers.c: By reducing motor speed to zero.

explanations.a: Incorrect: PWM only controls speed, not direction.
explanations.b: Correct: H-bridge (e.g., L298N) flips polarity to reverse direction.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Speed zero does not reverse rotation.
explanations.d: Incorrect: analogRead has no relation to direction.

questions.question: Why are stepper motors commonly used in CNC machines?

answers.a: Because they rotate freely at high speeds.
answers.b: Because they provide precise step-by-step movement.
answers.c: Because they require no driver circuits.
answers.d: Because they consume very low power.

explanations.a: Incorrect: CNC requires precision, not free rotation.
explanations.b: Correct: Stepper motors allow exact positioning needed in CNC.
explanations.c: Incorrect: CNC machines always use driver circuits.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Steppers actually consume more power during holding.

questions.question: What is the role of driver circuits in motor control?

answers.a: They reduce motor voltage to zero.
answers.b: They deliver high current safely from microcontrollers.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Drivers do not suppress voltage unnecessarily.
explanations.b: Correct: Drivers allow motors to draw high current without damaging Arduino.
explanations.c: Incorrect: PWM still comes from Arduino.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Temperature sensing is not their job.
